sen.j: 一方、現在の由良川最上流部である上谷と下谷の合流点である中山付近を境として、東部の長治谷から上谷にかけた一帯は古くから朽木村西部の針畑郷とのつながりが強く、用材も地蔵峠を越えて朽木方面に搬出されていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the area from Chojidani to Kamidani (upper valley) in the east of Nakayama, where the flow in Kamidani (upper valley) and that in Shimodani (lower valley) in the uppermost part of the Yura-gawa River met, had a strong connection with Harihata-go Community in the west of Kutsuki-mura Village from a long time ago, and wood materials were carried out to the Kuchiki area over the Jizo Pass.

On the other hand, the area from Chojidani to Kamidani (upper valley) in the east of Nakayama, where the flow in Kamidani (upper valley) and that in Shimodani (lower valley) in the uppermost part of the Yura-gawa River met, had a strong connection with Harihata-go Community in the west of Kutsuki-mura Village from a long time ago, and wood were carried out to the Kuchiki area over the Jizo Pass.

On the other hand, around Nakayama, the present upper most of Yura-gawa River where Kamidani (upper valley) and Shimodani (lower valley) meet as the border, the eastern area from Chojidani to Kamidani had a strong connection with Harihata-go Community in the west of Kutsuki-mura Village from a long time ago, and wood was carried out to the Kutsuki area over the Jizo Pass.
sen.cmt: Kuchiki area→Kutsuki area,原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: また、中山から長治谷、野田畑にかけては大きな木地師の集落があった。
sen.e: Furthermore, a big community of kijishi existed in the area from Nakayama to Chojidani and Nodabata.

where Kamidani (upper valley) and Shimodani (lower valley) meet

sen.j: こ集落は、下流の知井とはほとんどつながりがないかわりに、針畑郷や若狭知三村とつながっていた。
sen.e: This community had almost no connection with Chii at the downstream but had connections with Harihata-go Community and Chimi-mura Village, Wakasa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

This community had almost no connection with Chii downstream but had connections with Harihata-go Community and Chimi-mura Village, Wakasa Province.

sen.j: 現在でも野田畑の住居跡に、住民が植えた松やスモモの木が残っている。
sen.e: In Nodabata, the pine trees and Japanese plum tress that the residents there planted still remain even today.
In Nodabata, the pine trees and Japanese plum tress that the residents there planted still remain even today.
At the site of the old residences in Nodabata, the pine trees and Japanese plum tress that the residents there planted still remain even today.
sen.cmt: ”住居跡”という部分を付け加えました。

sen.j: 江戸時代には現在の当研究林のエリアは、 明治以降旧知井村を構成する北、南、中、下、江和、田歌、河内谷の各村が篠山藩領に、現在の事務所周辺にあたる芦生村をはじめ佐々里、白石、知見の四ヶ村が園部藩領となったのとは異なり天領として京都代官所が支配し、当初は知井の他地域の山林同様知井九ヶ村惣山として一括して扱われていた.
sen.e: In the Edo period, each village of Kita, Minami, Naka, Shimo, Ewa, and Kawauchidani, all of which became to constitute Chii-mura Village in Meiji and later eras, became to be included in the territory of Sasayama Domain, and the three villages of Sasari, Shiraishi, in addition to Ashiu Village that is located in the vicinity of the present administration building of this office is located became to be included in the territory of Sonobe Province, but the area corresponding to the present forest for research was controlled by Kyoto daikansho (regional office of administrative official) as a tenryo (bakufu-owned land) and was initially handled collectively as a mountain common to nine Chii villages, as the mountain forest in other Chii areas was.

In the Edo period, each village of Kita, Minami, Naka, Shimo, Ewa, Tota, and Kawauchidani, all of which became to constitute Chii-mura Village in Meiji and later eras, came to be included in the territory of Sasayama Domain, and the three villages of Sasari, Shiraishi, in addition to Ashiu Village that are located in the vicinity of the present administration building came to be included in the territory of Sonobe Domain, but the area corresponding to the present research forest was controlled by Kyoto daikansho (regional office of administrative official) as a tenryo (bakufu-owned land) and was initially handled collectively as a mountain common to the nine Chii villages, much as the mountain forest in other Chii areas was.
sen.cmt: ”田歌（とうた）: Tota”を挿入しました。Sonobe Province→Sonobe Domain

sen.j: しかしながら、他地域の山林の山検地が進むにつれて、知井九ヶ村の人々が利用している山は芦生奥山、針畑郷の人々が利用している山はおろし山として、それぞれ独立した扱いを受けるようになっていった。
sen.e: However, as survey of mountain forests in other areas progressed, the mountain that was used by people in the nine Chii villages and the mountain used by people in Harihata-go Community became to be handled independently as Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain and Oroshi-yama Mountain, respectively.

sen.j: その境界付近にある中山社は「うつしの宮」と呼ばれており、周辺は「ちまた山」として両村の入会山であった。
sen.e: Nakayama-sha Shrine located around the boundary between the two mountains was called "Utsu shi Shrine," and the area around the shrine was called "Chimata-yama (everybody's mountain) and was a mountain shared by people in both villages.

Nakayama-sha Shrine located around the boundary between the two mountains was called "Utsu shi Shrine," and the area around the shrine was called "Chimata-yama (everybody's mountain) and was a mountain shared by people in both villages.

Nakayama-sha Shrine located around the boundary between the two mountains was called "Utsu shi Shrine," and the area around the shrine was called "Chimata-yama (everybody's mountain)" and was a mountain shared by people in both villages.

sen.j: このように、古くから多くの人々が入山、居住していた地域であるが、
sen.e: Thus, many people had entered and lived in this area from a long time ago.

sen.e: Thus, there were many people that had settled and lived in this area since long ago.
Thus, there were many people that had settled and lived in this area since long ago.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期には大半の山番が下山、明治時代の初めには佐々里峠の入り口である灰野に残るのみとなった。
sen.e: However, in the latter half of the Edo period, most of the mountain guardians who had lived there left, and in the early Meiji period, only Haino placed at the entrance to Sasari Pass remained.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the latter half of the Edo period, most of the mountain guardians who had lived there left, and in the early Meiji period, only Haino placed at the entrance to Sasari Pass remained.

However, in the latter half of the Edo period, most of the mountain guardians who had lived there left, then only a few remained in Haino located at the entrance to Sasari Pass in the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: 木地師は山中を移動しながら村を構えていたが、別の山へ移住するものもあれば、時には飢饉で一村全滅という悲惨な事態を迎えた村もあった。
sen.e: Kijishi (wood masters) formed villages while moving within mountains, but some of them moved to other villages and it also happened sometimes that an entire village perished due to famine.
Kijishi (wood masters) formed villages while moving within mountains, but some of them moved to other villages and it also happened sometimes that an entire village perished due to famine.
Kijishi (wood masters) formed villages while moving within mountains, but some of them moved to other mountains and it also happened sometimes that an entire village perished due to famine.
sen.cmt: ”別の山へ移住”という部分を修正しました。

sen.j: こちらも明治初期には若狭から野田畑に3戸が移住して、杓子などの木製品を製造していた。
sen.e: Here as well, three households moved to Nodabata from Wakasa, and engaged in manufacturing wooden products, such as dippers.
Here as well, three households moved to Nodabata from Wakasa, and engaged in manufacturing wooden products, such as dippers.
Here as well, three households moved to Nodabata from Wakasa, and engaged in manufacturing wooden products, such as dippers.

sen.j: ただ、これらの人々も明治中期までは知井村の人々と交流がなかった。
sen.e: However, these people had no contact with those in Chii Village until the middle of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, these people had no contact with those in Chii Village until the middle of the Meiji period.
However, these people had no contact with those in Chii Village until the middle of the Meiji period.

sen.j: このため、由良川上流から杓子が流れてきたことに驚いた灰野の村人が戸長役場に連絡した。
sen.e: Being surprised to find a dipper that flew down the Yura-gawa River, a villager in Haino reported it to the kocho-yakuba (a village office whose head was appointed by the government).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Surprised at finding a dipper that had floated down the Yura-gawa River, a villager in Haino reported it to the kocho-yakuba (a village office whose head was appointed by the government).
Surprised at finding a dipper that had floated down the Yura-gawa River, a villager in Haino reported it to the office of the head of the village.
sen.cmt: 戸長役場：office of the head of the villageとしました。

sen.j: そして、探検隊を組織してこれらの人々を「発見」し、1889年10月に戸籍を作成した。
sen.e: Then an expedition team was organized, "finding" these people, and family registers were created for them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: An expedition team was organized, and upon "finding" these people, family registers were created for them.
An expedition team was organized, and upon "finding" these people, family registers were created in October 1889.

sen.j: こうした経過が当時の新聞に「現代の桃源郷」や「明治村」として報道されたという話が残っている。
sen.e: It is said that the sequence of the events concerned was reported in papers at that time as "A present utopia" or "A Meiji village."
It is said that the sequence of events was reported in papers at that time as "A present utopia" or "A Meiji village."
It is said that the sequence of events was reported in papers at that time as "A present utopia" or "A Meiji village."

sen.j: 明治以降はこの地域全体が知井村となり、芦生奥山やおろし山などと漠然と呼ばれていた当研究林のエリアは、地租改正によって山林土地台帳も整備された。
sen.e: After entering the Meiji period, this area as a whole became to be included in Chii Village, and the area of this forest for research, called vaguely as Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain or Oroshi-yama Mountain, became to be registered in the forest cadaster due to land-tax reform.

After entering the Meiji period, this area as a whole came to be included in Chii Village, and the area of this research forest, referred to vaguely as Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain or Oroshi-yama Mountain, came to be registered in the forest cadaster due to land-tax reform.

Since the Meiji period, this area as a whole came to be included in Chii Village, and the area of this research forest, referred to vaguely as Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain or Oroshi-yama Mountain, came to be registered in the forest cadaster due to land-tax reform.

sen.j: しかしながら、従来の九ヶ村惣山が九ヶ村共有林と呼び方が変わったにしてもこの地域における山林利用の形態に大きな変化はなく、従来同様知井や針畑から入山して、製炭を中心に、生活用品の原材料となる雑木を伐採して生計を立てていた。
sen.e: However, even though the expression of "a mountain common to nine Chii villages" was changed to "a mountain shared by nine villages," the ways of using the forests in this area changed little, and the people there entered the mountains, made charcoal mainly and cut miscellaneous small trees to be used for creating everyday utensils, to earn their livings.

However, even though the expression of "a mountain common to nine Chii villages" was changed to "a mountain shared by nine villages," the ways of using the forests in this area changed little, and the people there entered the mountains and earned their living mainly through creating charcoal mainly while cutting miscellaneous trees to produce everyday utensils.

However, even though the expression of "a mountain common to nine Chii villages" was changed to "a mountain shared by nine villages," the ways of using the forests in this area changed little, and the people there entered the mountains and earned their living mainly through creating charcoal while cutting miscellaneous trees to produce everyday utensils.

sen.j: こうした山林利用の形態も明治中期以降から徐々に変化していく。
sen.e: Such ways of using the forest changed gradually after the middle of the Meiji period.
This way of using the forest changed gradually after the middle of the Meiji period.
This way of using the forest changed gradually after the middle of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 雑木の利用から杉やヒノキといった用材を植林して山林経営を図るといった考え方が入ってくるようになり、面積広大な当研究林のエリアを事業の対象とする思惑が働くようになった。
sen.e: The forest business-managing concept that trees more useful for constructing buildings, such as Japanese cedar or Japanese cypress should be planted instead of using miscellaneous small trees began to enter the area, and it became to be speculated to make the vast area of this forest for research be targeted for business.

The forest business-managing concept that considered that trees more useful for constructing buildings, such as Japanese cedar or Japanese cypress should be planted instead of using other small trees began to take hold, and the vast area of this research forest was targeted for business.

The forest business-managing concept that the trees more useful for materials such as Japanese cedar or Japanese cypress should be planted instead of using other small trees began to take hold, and the vast area of this research forest was targeted for business.
sen.cmt: 用材:materials とし、修正しました。

sen.j: 財政基盤の脆弱な知井村では広大な山林を対象とした事業の実施が困難であったこと。
sen.e: It was difficult for Chi Village, with a weak financial base, to conduct business for the vast forest by itself.

sen.e: It was difficult for Chi Village, that had a weak financial base, to conduct business for the vast forest by itself.

sen.j: そこで、銀行の融資を受けて資金を確保しようとした。
sen.e: Therefore, the village attempted to borrow money from banks to finance the business.

sen.j: しかしながら、木材を搬出するにしても交通の便をはじめとした地理的条件があまりにも悪かった。
sen.e: However, since the village was located in an area where only in carrying out woods, the necessary geographical conditions, including transportation, were too poor there.

sen.cmt: 原文から考えて全体を修正しました。

sen.j: そのため、融資の話もいつしか立ち消えとなった。
sen.e: Therefore, the issue of financing the business faded away.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the idea of financing the business faded away.
Therefore, the idea of financing the business faded away.

sen.j: その後もこの地域における山林経営が村政運営の課題として採り上げられた。
sen.e: Even after that, the issue of forest business was taken up and discussed as a problem to be handled by the village government.

sen.e: Even after that, the issue of forest business was taken up and discussed as a problem to be handled by the village government.
Even after that, the issue of forest business was taken up and discussed as a problem to be handled by the village government.

sen.j: しかしながら、財政面や有力者の思惑などから手付かずのまま推移していった。
sen.e: However, such business remained not started due to its financial aspect and speculation of powerful persons in the village.

However, the business was never started due to its financial aspect and speculation by powerful persons in the village.

sen.j: また、野田畑に住んでいた人々も明治末期までに朽木村や名田庄村へと下山し、無住の地となった。
sen.e: In addition, the people who lived in Nodabata had moved down to Kuchiki Village or Natasho Village until the end of the Meiji period, making the place uninhabited.
In addition, the people who lived in Nodabata had moved down to Kuchiki Village or Natasho Village until the end of the Meiji period, leaving the place uninhabited.
In addition, the people who lived in Nodabata had moved down to Kuchiki Village or Natasho Village until the end of the Meiji period, leaving the place uninhabited.

sen.j: 1910年8月25日に現在の山陰本線の園部駅～綾部駅間が開通、同日に和知駅が開設された。
sen.e: On August 25, 1910, present Sanin Main Line started its operation between Sonobe Station and Asabe Station, and Wachi Station was established on the same day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On August 25, 1910, the present Sanin Main Line started operation between Sonobe Station and Asabe Station, and Wachi Station was established on the same day.
On August 25, 1910, the present Sanin Main Line started operation between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station, and Wachi Station was established on the same day.

sen.j: それから、伐採した材木を筏流しで由良川を和知まで流し、和知から列車で発送することで輸送コストの削減と大量搬出が可能になった。
sen.e: Then use of trains for transporting woods from Wachi made it possible to carry out lots of woods at lower transportation costs, because cut woods could be formed into rafts and could be flown down the Yura-gawa River to Wachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The use of trains for transporting wood from Wachi made it possible to carry out lots of wood at lower transportation costs, because cut wood could be formed into rafts and sent down the Yura-gawa River to Wachi.
Then, by using trains to transport it from Wachi after rafting cut wood down the Yura-gawa River to Wachi made it possible to cut the cost of transportation and bulk-transportation.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて、全体を修正しました。

sen.j: 同時に、鉄道に欠かせない枕木の用材としてクリ材の需要が急増した。
sen.e: At the same time, demand for the chestnut woods indispensable for the railroad ties of railways increased rapidly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the same time, demand for chestnut wood indispensable for the railroad ties of railways increased rapidly.
At the same time, demand for chestnut wood indispensable for the railroad ties of railways increased rapidly.

sen.j: そのため、樹木の豊かな由良川源流域から栗材を伐採、枕木に加工して散流（バラで流すこと）するか筏に組んで由良川を和知まで流すことが次第に増えていった。
sen.e: Therefore, the following cases increased gradually: Chestnut tress in the riverhead area of the Yura-gawa River, where trees grew abundantly, were cut and made into railroad ties, and then each piece of them or the rafts composed of these ties were flown down the Yura-gaawa River to Wachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the following cases increased gradually: Chestnut tress in the riverhead area of the Yura-gawa River, where trees grew abundantly, were cut and made into railroad ties, and then each piece or the rafts composed of these ties were sent down the Yura-gaawa River to Wachi.

Therefore, the following cases increased gradually: Chestnut tress in the headwaters area of the Yura-gawa River, where trees grew abundantly, were cut and made into railroad ties and then floated down the Yura-gaawa River to Wachi either as individual pieces or as rafts.
sen.cmt: riverhead→headwaters 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: このような状況に目をつけた三井本社が、大正時代初期から中期にかけて、芦生奥山の林産資源確保のために知井村と予備交渉を持ったという話が残っている。
sen.e: It is said that, noticing this situation, the Mitsui Company conducted preliminary negotiations with the Chii Village side in 1910s to secure resources for the forest industry in Ashiu Oku-yam Mountain.

It is said that, the Mitsui Company noticed this situation and conducted preliminary negotiations with the Chii Village side in 1910s to secure resources for the forest industry in Ashiu Oku-yam Mountain.

It is said that, the Mitsui Company noticed this situation and conducted preliminary negotiations with the Chii Village side from the early to middle of the Taisho period to secure the forest resource in Ashiu Oku-yam Mountain.
sen.cmt: in 1910sを削除し、”大正時代初期から中期”の部分を修正しました。resources for the forest industry→forest resource

sen.j: 当研究林をはじめとしたこの地域の山林の所有形態は、明治以降も、他地域のように大規模な山林地主が所有するものでも、土佐や木曽のように江戸時代は藩有林だったものを皇室財産として宮内省帝室林野局に移管したものでも、農商務省 (日本)山林局が監督する国有林でもなく、部落共有林として地域住民の共有財産として扱われていた。
sen.e: The ownership of each forest in the areas including this forest for research was dealt with as a common forest of the community or as a collective property of the residents in the area even after the start of the Meiji period: not as in other areas where a few persons owned a vast forest area, not as in Tosa and Kiso where domain-owned forests in the Edo period were transferred to Imperial Forestry Bureau of Imperial Household Ministry as the Imperial property, nor as national forests supervised by the forest bureau of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (in Japan).

The ownership of each forest in the areas including this forest for research was dealt with as a common forest of the community or as a collective property of the residents in the area even after the start of the Meiji period: not as in other areas where a few persons owned a vast forest area, not as in Tosa and Kiso where domain-owned forests in the Edo period were transferred to Imperial Forestry Bureau of Imperial Household Ministry as the Imperial property, nor as national forests supervised by the forest bureau of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (in Japan).

The ownership of each forest in the areas including this forest for research was dealt with as a common forest of the community or as a collective property of the residents in the area even after the start of the Meiji period: not as in other areas where a few persons owned a vast forest area, not as in Tosa and Kiso where domain-owned forests in the Edo period were transferred to Imperial Forestry Bureau of Imperial Household Ministry as the Imperial property, nor as national forests supervised by the forest bureau of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (in Japan).

sen.j: こうした共有林は、1889年の市制町村制施行当初から、内務省 (日本)では財政基盤確立と各市町村の体力強化のため、部落有林をはじめとした部落有財産を各市町村財産に統合することを推進していた。
sen.e: Concerning these common forests, there was the following movement since the time when The Municipal Government Act was enforced in 1899: Ministry of Interior (in Japan) promoted to integrate the properties owned by each community, including the forests owned by each community, into the corresponding city, town or village property, to establish and strengthen the financial base of each city, town or village property.

Concerning these common forests, the following movement was carried out since the time when The Municipal Government Act was enforced in 1899: Ministry of Interior (in Japan) promoted the integration of properties owned by each community, including the forests owned by each community, into the corresponding city, town or village property, to establish and strengthen the financial base of each city, town or village property.

Concerning these common forests, the following movement was carried out since the time when The Municipal Government Act was enforced in 1889: Ministry of Interior (in Japan) promoted the integration of properties owned by each community, including the forests owned by each community, into the corresponding city, town or village property, to establish and strengthen the financial base of each city, town or village property.

sen.j: 財産統合は各市町村内において有力者の利害関係や集落間の強弱関係が錯綜することから当初はなかなか進展しなかった。
sen.e: In each city, town or village, the integration of properties initially had not progressed smoothly because powerful men's interests or power relationships among communities were conflicted or complicated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In each city, town or village, the integration of properties initially had not progressed smoothly because powerful men's interests or power relationships among communities either conflicted or complicated the issue.

In each city, town or village, the integration of properties initially had not progressed smoothly because influential persons' interests or power relationships among communities either conflicted or complicated the issue.

sen.j: しかしながら、日露戦争終了後の各市町村の財政窮乏を期に、明治後期から大正、昭和にかけて強力に進められるようになった。
sen.e: However, starting at the time when the finance of each of the cities, towns and villages suffered badly after the end of Russo-Japanese War, the integration became to be promoted strongly from the latter half of the Meiji period to the Taisho and to the Showa periods.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, starting at the time when the finance of each of the cities, towns and villages suffered badly after the end of Russo-Japanese War, integration came to be strongly promoted from the latter half of the Meiji period to the Taisho and Showa periods.

However, starting at the time when the finance of each of the cities, towns and villages suffered badly after the end of Russo-Japanese War, integration came to be strongly promoted from the latter half of the Meiji period to the Taisho and Showa periods.

sen.j: 知井村では1902年に学校基本財産として学校林が設定されていたが、明治末期から部落有林の統一に向けた動きが多くの議論を重ねながら進められていった。
sen.e: In Chii Village, school forests were established in 1902 as a basic property of the school, and the integration of the forests owned by communities was promoted through many discussions from towards the end of the Meiji period.

In Chii Village, school forests were established in 1902 as a basic property of the school, and the integration of the forests owned by communities was promoted through many discussions from towards the end of the Meiji period.

In Chii Village, school forests were established in 1902 as a basic property of the school, but the movement of the integration of the forests to be owned by communities was promoted through many discussions from the end of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: and→but 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: この時期、京都帝国大学においてはそれまでの分科大学制を改めて学部制を採用することとなり、1923年に農学部を設置することが決定された。
sen.e: Around this time, Kyoto Imperial University decided to employ a departmental system, replacing the university system composed of separate colleges, and decided to establish an agricultural department in 1923.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Around this time, Kyoto Imperial University decided to employ a departmental system, replacing the university system composed of separate colleges, and decided to establish an agricultural department in 1923.

Around this time, Kyoto Imperial University decided to employ a departmental system, replacing the university system composed of separate colleges, and decided to establish an agricultural faculty in 1923.

sen.j: しかし、従来から存在する京都帝大の演習林は、台湾・朝鮮半島・樺太といった当時日本の海外領土であった地域にしかなかった。
sen.e: However, at the time, the forests for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University were provided only in Taiwan, the Korean Peninsula and Sakhalin, all of which were oversea Japanese territories.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, at the time, the field practice forests for Kyoto Imperial University were provided only in Taiwan, the Korean Peninsula and Sakhalin, all of which were overseas Japanese territories.
However, at the time, the field practice forests for Kyoto Imperial University were provided only in Taiwan, the Korean Peninsula and Sakhalin, all of which were overseas Japanese territories.

sen.j: このため、国内で演習林を設置することが求められていた。
sen.e: Therefore, it was strongly requested to establish a forest for field practice in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it was strongly requested that a field practice forest be established inJapan.
Therefore, it was strongly requested that a field practice forest be established in Japan.

sen.j: こうしたことから京都府下や滋賀県内を中心に適地の調査が進められ、芦生奥山も候補地のひとつであった。
sen.e: In such a situation, the survey to find an area appropriate for the forest was conducted mostly in Kyoto Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture, with Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain included as a candidate as well.
Under this situation, a survey to find an area appropriate for the forest was conducted mostly in Kyoto Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture, with Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain included as a candidate as well.
Under this situation, a survey to find an area appropriate for the forest was conducted mostly in Kyoto Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture, with Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain included as a candidate as well.

sen.j: 調査の過程で芦生奥山は演習林最適地との評価をつけられた。
sen.e: In the process of conducting the survey, Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain was rated as being most appropriate for the forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the process of conducting the survey, Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain was rated as being most appropriate as the site for the field practice forest.
In the process of conducting the survey, Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain was rated as being the most appropriate as the site for the field practice forest.

sen.j: さらに、行政側においても、広大かつ地理的条件の悪い芦生奥山の管理は、部落有林の村有財産への統一後には知井村の手に余ることが予想された。
sen.e: In addition, because Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain was vast and was located at a geographically disadvantageous place, the government side also considered that it would be too much for Chii Village to manage Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain after the forests owned by the communities were integrated into the village properties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Addtionally, because Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain was vast and was located at a geographically disadvantageous place, the government side also considered that it would be too much for Chii Village to manage Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain after the forests owned by the communities were integrated into the village properties.

Additionally, because Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain was vast and was located at a geographically disadvantageous place, the government side also considered that it would be too much for Chii Village to manage Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain after the forests owned by the communities were integrated into the village properties.

sen.j: したがって、京都府では京都帝大の持つステータスを考慮して、北桑田郡制の陣頭指揮の下、芦生奥山への演習林誘致に向けた斡旋を進めていった。
sen.e: Therefore, considering the status of Kyoto Imperial University, the Kyoto Prefecture government made negotiations to have Ashiu Oku-yama mountain selected for the forest-for-field-practice site under the initiative of the Kitakuwa County government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, considering the status of Kyoto Imperial University, the Kyoto Prefecture government negotiated to have Ashiu Oku-yama mountain selected as the forest-for-field-practice site under the initiative of the Kitakuwa County government.

Therefore, considering the status of Kyoto Imperial University, the Kyoto prefectural government negotiated to have Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain selected as the forest-for-field-practice site under the initiative of the Kitakuwada County government.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Prefecture government→Kyoto prefectural governmentAshiu Oku-yama mountain→Ashu Oku-yama MountainKitakuwa County→Kitakuwada County

sen.j: ここに大学側、行政側の動きが合致したことから芦生奥山が演習林として決定された。
sen.e: Because the actions of the university side and those of the government side coincided, it was decided that Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain should be selected as the forest-for-field-practice site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since the actions of the university side coincided with those of the government side, it was decided that Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain should be selected as the forest-for-field-practice site.
Since the actions of the university side coincided with those of the government side, it was decided that Ashiu Oku-yama Mountain should be selected as the forest-for-field-practice site.

sen.j: それから、1921年4月4日に大学側と土地所有者(代表：知井村長)との間で99年間の地上権設定契約が締結された。
sen.e: Then on April 4, 1921, an agreement on creation of superficies for 99 years was concluded between the university side and the owners of the land (represented by village headman Murai).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then on April 4, 1921, an agreement on the creation of superficies for 99 years was concluded between the university side and the owners of the land (represented by village headman Murai).
Then on April 4, 1921, an agreement on the creation of surface rights for 99 years was concluded between the university side and the owners of the land (represented by village headman Murai).

sen.j: ここに京都帝国大学芦生演習林が誕生した。
sen.e: In this way, the forest for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University was born.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this way, the forest for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University was born.
Here, the forest for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University was begun.
sen.cmt: In this way→Hereこの場合の”born”は不自然であると思われるので、”begun”に修正しました。

tit.e: The birth of the forest for field practice (the second period)
The birth of the forest for field practice (the second period)
The launch of the forest for field practice (the second period)
tit.cmt: “birth”は不自然であると思われるので、”launch”に修正しました。

sen.j: こうして誕生した芦生演習林であった。
sen.e: This forest for field practice was born in this way.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this way the field practice forest was born.
In this way the field practice forest was launched.

sen.j: その時、すでにあった東京大学や北海道大学といった他の帝国大学の国内演習林が国有林設定の形で演習林地を取得していた。
sen.e: At that time, such forests for field practice of other imperial universities, Tokyo University and of Hokkaido University, already existed in Japan, and these forests were acquired as national properties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At that time, such forests for field practice of other imperial universities, Tokyo University and of Hokkaido University, already existed in Japan, and these forests were acquired as national properties.

At that time, such forests for field practice of other imperial universities, Tokyo University and of Hokkaido University, already existed in Japan, and these forests were acquired as national properties.

sen.j: したがって、伐採した材木の販売益を100%自らの収入とできた。
sen.e: Therefore, all of the profits from selling the woods cut there became their own income.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, all profit from selling the wood cut there became their own income.
Therefore, 100% of the profit from selling the wood cut there became their own income.
sen.cmt: all profit→100% of the profitと修正しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、地上権を設定した借地契約であり、収益については当初40年間は地上権者が地権者に最初の5年は年5万円ずつ、残り35年間は毎年1万円ずつ支払い、その後は伐採した材木の販売益を地権者と折半する分収方式であった。
sen.e: On the other hand, this forest land was leased, with superficies set to it, in the following conditions: For the first 40 years, the person with the right of using the land should pay to the land-owing person 50,000 yen every year for the first five years, should pay 10,000 yen every year for the succeeding 35 years, and after that, half of the profit from selling the woods cut there should be paid to the land-owning person.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, this forest land was leased, with superficies set to it, in the following conditions: For the first 40 years, the person with the right of using the land should pay to the land-owing person 50,000 yen every year for the first five years, should pay 10,000 yen every year for the succeeding 35 years, and after that, half of the profit from selling the woods cut there should be paid to the land-owning person.
sen.cmt: Robert: "with superficies set to it" doesn’t make sense
sen.e: On the other hand, the terms of the lease granted surface rights to the forest land according to the following conditions: the surface rights owner was obliged to pay the land owner 50,000 yen every year for the first five years of the initial 40-year period and then 10,000 yen every year for the remaining 35 years, after which half of any profits made from the selling of any trees logged there were to be paid to the land owner.
sen.cmt: superficies→surface rights,in→under,succeeding→remaining I'm afraid "with surface rights set to it" doesn't make any more sense than "with superficies set to it". I've had to rewrite this quite a lot.

sen.j: これは先発の大学に早く追いつきたいが、広大な林地を買収するだけの財政的な裏付けがないことから、やむを得ず選択された手法であった。
sen.e: This was a method selected reluctantly, because Kyoto University wanted to catch up with the two universities but there was no financial support available to purchase the vast forest.
This method was selected reluctantly, because Kyoto University wanted to catch up to the two universities but there was no financial support available to purchase the vast forest.
This method was selected reluctantly, because Kyoto University wanted to catch up to the other universities but there was no financial support available to purchase the vast forest.

sen.j: ところが、契約後間もない1922年3月に当初地権者と契約していた分配金5万円が支払われず、同年8月になって年間の伐採益の全額として村に支払われた金額が1万円だけだった。
sen.e: However, an incident happened in March of 1922, relatively soon after the conclusion of the contract, that the promised 50,000 yen was not paid to the land-owning side and only 10,000 yen was paid in August of the same year as all of the profits that had been gained from cutting woods there for a year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, an incident happened in March of 1922, relatively soon after the conclusion of the contract, that the promised 50,000 yen was not paid to the land-owning side and only 10,000 yen was paid in August of the same year as all of the profits that had been gained from cutting wood over the space of a year.

However, an incident happened in March 1922, soon after the conclusion of the contract, that the promised 50,000 yen was not paid to the land-owning side and only 10,000 yen was paid in August of the same year as all of the profits that had been gained from cutting wood over the space of a year.

sen.j: このことから、契約の不履行として、告訴も含めた大きな騒ぎとなってしまった。
sen.e: Therefore, it developed into a big trouble as a default of agreement, with the measure of bringing a lawsuit taken as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it developed into a big issue as a default of the agreement, and a lawsuit was formed as well.
Therefore, it developed into a big issue as a default of the agreement, and a lawsuit was formed as well.

sen.j: 結局、大学、京都府、地元を交えた議論の中で調停が行われ、1923年4月に契約の一部を修正して、地権者側の伐採収益取得の権利を地上権者側に譲渡し、地上権者側は代償として、39年間の借地料金利の積算額である22万円を同年中に地権者側に支払うことで和解した。
sen.e: After all, mediation was attempted through discussions among the university, Kyoto Prefecture and the local persons concerned, and they were reconciled in April of 1923 in the following conditions that modified some portions of the original contract details: The land-owning-person-side right of acquiring profit from cutting woods there should be transferred to the university side, and the person with the right of using the land should pay to the land-owning person 220,000 yen that amounted to the accumulation of interests for land rent for 39 years, to compensate the transfer of the right.

Mediation attempts weremade through discussions among the university, Kyoto Prefecture and the local persons concerned, and they were reconciled in April of 1923 according to the following conditions that modified some portions of the original contract details: The land-owning-person-side right of acquiring profit from cutting woods there should be transferred to the university side, and the person with the right to use the land should pay the land-owning person 220,000 yen that amounted to the accumulation of interests for land rent over 39 years, to compensate for the transfer of the right.

sen.cmt: weremade→were made, local persons→local people,ofを削除しました。スペースを修正しました。

sen.j: このような山林地上権での基準対価による契約更改は京都府下においては前例のないものであった。
sen.e: Concerning such renewal of a contract based on standard price for the right of using the forest land, there was no precedent in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.e: There was no precedent in Kyoto Prefecture for the renewal of a contract based on standard price for the right of using the forest land.

sen.j: したがって、地上権を固定額で契約したことも含めて後々村側に不利になった側面があったことは否めない。
sen.e: Therefore, it cannot be denied that this renewal, concluding the contract that included the clause of "paying a fixed amount of money for the right of using the land," worked disadvantageously for the village side later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it cannot be denied that this renewal, concluding the contract that included the clause of "paying a fixed amount of money for the right of using the land," later proved to be a disadvantage for the village side.

Therefore, it cannot be denied that this renewal, concluding the contract that included the clause of "paying a fixed amount of money for the right of using the land," later proved to be a disadvantage for the village side.

sen.j: ただ、知井村の側においてもこの22万円を基金として部落有林の一元化を実現した
sen.e: However, using this 220,00 yean as a fund, the Chii village side could achieve the unification of the forests owned by the communities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, using this 220,00 yean as a fund, the Chii village side could achieve the unification of the forests owned by the communities.
However, using this 220,000 yen as a fund, the Chii village side could achieve the unification of the forests owned by the communities.

sen.j: だけでなく、戦前には村の財政において演習林からの安定した財産収入が、昭和恐慌期において村財政を窮乏から救った効果は大きいといえる。
sen.e: In addition, it can also be said that, concerning the village finance in the pre-war years, the stable income from the forest for field practice contributed significantly to rescue the village finance from suffering during the Showa depression period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, it can also be said that, concerning the village finance in the pre-war years, the stable income from the field practice forest contributed significantly to rescuing the village finances which had suffered during the Showa depression.

In addition, it can also be said that, concerning the village finance in the prewar years, the stable income from the field practice forest contributed significantly to rescue the village finances, which had suffered during the Showa Depression.
sen.cmt: pre-war→prewarShowa depression→Showa Depression,to rescuing→to rescue,カンマを挿入しました。

sen.j: また、契約時に木材搬出ルートの設定を、隣接する朽木村経由や佐々里峠を越えて広河原や花脊を経由するものではなく、村内を東西に横断する形で設定するよう求めたり、天然更新林での伐採や処分の権利が喪失しないように求めている。
sen.e: The village side also requested the following items when concluding the contract: the routes to carry out woods cut should be provided so as to run through the village in the east-west direction, not so as to run through Hirogawara or Hanase via adjacent Kuchiki Village or passing Sasari Pass, and the village side's rights of cutting woods and of disposing them in the forests of natural regeneration should not be lost.

The village side also requested the following items when concluding the contract: the routes to carry wood should be provided so as to run through the village in the east-west direction, not so as to run through Hirogawara or Hanase via adjacent Kuchiki Village or passing Sasari Pass, and the village side's rights to cut wood and disposing them in the forests of natural regeneration should not be lost.

The village side also requested the following items when concluding the contract: the routes to carry wood should be provided so as to run through the village in the east-west direction, not so as to run through Hirogawara or Hanase via adjacent Kutsuki-mura Village or passing Sasari Pass, and the village side's rights to cut wood and disposing them in the forests of natural regeneration should not be lost.
sen.cmt: Kuchiki Village→Kutsuki-mura Village （この場合、前後との接続を考えてVillage を足しました）

sen.j: この他、演習林の開設によって地元芦生の住民をはじめ地域住民の雇用の場を創出した効果も大きいといえる。
sen.e: In addition, it can also be said that the establishment of this forest for field practice contributed quite effectively to the creation of job opportunities for residents in Ashiu and other local communities.

In addition, it can also be said that the establishment of this forest for field practice contributed quite effectively to the creation of job opportunities for residents in Ashiu and other local communities.

sen.j: 一方でこのような騒ぎをよそに、施設の整備は進められていった。
sen.e: On the other hand, regardless of these troubles, facilities necessary there had been provided steadily.
On the other hand, regardless of these troubles, facilities had been steadily provided that were necessary to the area.
On the other hand, regardless of these troubles, facilities had been steadily provided there.

sen.j: 1923年に演習林事務所が建築されたのを皮切りに、林内での作業所や苗畑といった施設の設置が行われたほか、1925年には出合（現在の京都府道38号京都広河原美山線との分岐点）から演習林事務所に至る車道が開設され、1927年には由良川源流に沿って事務所から七瀬に至る森林軌道の軌道敷開削工事が開始、1934年には事務所～赤崎間にレールが敷かれた。
sen.e: After the construction of the administration building for the forestry for field practice was completed in 1923, the following facilities were built one after another: Such facilities as work sites in the forest and fields for young plans were established, a road for vehicles from Deai (a point branching from the present Kyoto Prefecture Road No.38 Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Route) to the administration building in the forest for field practice was laid out in 1925, the engineering work for laying out rails for a forest tramroad from the administration building to Nanase, along the uppermost flow of the Yura-gawa River, was started in 1927, and the rails were laid out between the administration building and Akazaki 1934.

After the construction of the administration building for the field practice forest was completed in 1923, the following facilities were built one after another: facilities such as work sites in the forest and fields for young plans were established, a road for vehicles from Deai (a point branching from the present Kyoto Prefecture Road No.38 Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Route) to the administration building in the field practice forest was laid out in 1925, the engineering work for laying out rails for a forest tramroad from the administration building to Nanase, along the uppermost flow of the Yura-gawa River, was started in 1927, and rails were laid out between the administration building and Akazaki 1934.

After the construction of the administration building for the field practice forest was completed in 1923, the following facilities were built one after another: facilities such as work sites in the forest and fields for seedlings were established, a road for vehicles from Deai (a point branching from the present Kyoto Prefectural Road No.38 Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Route) to the administration building in the field practice forest was laid out in 1925, the engineering work for laying out rails for a forest tramline from the administration building to Nanase, along the uppermost flow of the Yura-gawa River, was started in 1927, and rails were laid out between the administration building and Akazaki in 1934.

sen.j: なお、演習林事務所については1930年に現在の事務所が新築された。
sen.e: By the way, concerning the administration office, the present one was newly built in 1930.
The present administration building was newly built in 1930.
Regarding the administration building, the present building was newly built in 1930.
sen.cmt: 原文より修正しました。

sen.j: また、施業の面では1924年に造林事業が、1925年にはしいたけの栽培が開始され、 1933年からは木炭の製造も開始されている。
sen.e: Concerning its business aspect, afforestation business started in 1924, the cultivation of shiitake mushroom started in 1925 and making charcoal started in 1933.
Concerning its business aspect, afforestation business started in 1924, the cultivation of shiitake mushroom started in 1925 and charcoal making started in 1933.
Concerning its business aspect, afforestation business started in 1924, the cultivation of shiitake mushroom started in 1925 and charcoal making started in 1933.

sen.j: 造林事業については、当初杉の伐採を行ったところ林相の悪化を招いたために一時伐採を中止した。
sen.e: Concerning the afforestation business, cutting woods made the forest physiognomy deteriorated initially, and the cutting work was stopped temporarily.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Concerning the afforestation business, logging initially deteriorated the forest physiognomy and logging was stopped temporarily.
Concerning the afforestation business, logging initially deteriorated the forest physiognomy and logging was stopped temporarily.

sen.j: その後はしいたけ栽培や木炭の製造のための雑木伐採、枕木用の栗材の伐採跡に杉の造林を行った。
sen.e: Then miscellaneous small trees were cut to cultivate shiitake mushroom and to make charcoal, and Japanese cedar trees were planted at the site where chestnut tress were cut to make railroad ties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then miscellaneous small trees were cut to cultivate shiitake mushroom and make charcoal, and Japanese cedar trees were planted at the site where chestnut tress were cut to make railroad ties.
Then miscellaneous small trees were cut to cultivate shiitake mushroom and make charcoal, and Japanese cedar trees were planted at the site where chestnut tress were cut to make railroad ties.

sen.j: この時期の演習林では、学術的な研究を重視した経営方針が立てられていた。
sen.e: For the forest for field practice at this era, a business policy of placing emphasis on academic research was employed.
A business policy of placing emphasis on academic research was employed for the field practice forest during this era.
A business policy of placing emphasis on academic research was employed for the field practice forest during this era.

sen.j: 当時の京都帝大の演習林では台湾演習林において樟脳の生産が行われ、樺太演習林においては材木の伐採によって収益を上げていた。
sen.e: Of the forests for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University, camphor was produced in the forest for field practice in Taiwan, and in the forest for field practice in Sakhalin, profits were earned from cutting woods.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Of the forests for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University, camphor was produced in the field practice forest in Taiwan, and in the field practice forest in Sakhalin, profits were earned from logging.

Of the forests for field practice of Kyoto Imperial University, camphor was produced in the field practice forest in Taiwan, and in the field practice forest in Sakhalin, profits were earned from logging.

sen.j: しかし、芦生演習林においては学術研究の実地拠点にしようとする期待が大きく、学術的な成果を挙げようとする動きが強く働いた。
sen.e: However, concerning the forest for field practice In Ashiu, it was largely expected to make the forest a site to conduct academic research, and the force to attain academic achievements worked strongly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However it was largely expected that the forest would be made into a site for conducting academic research, and there was a strong movement to attain academic achievements in the field practice forest in Ashiu.

However it was largely expected that the forest would be made into a site for conducting academic research, and there was a strong movement to attain academic achievements in the field practice forest in Ashiu.

sen.j: したがって、「営利的施業より理想的な施業」として、営利目的より学術的な成果を重視する立場を取っていた。
sen.e: Therefore, the policy of placing emphasis on attaining academic achievements rather than pursuing profits from business was employed as "Ideal business rather than business for pursuing profits."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the policy of placing an emphasis on attaining academic achievements rather than pursuing profits from business was employed as "Ideal business rather than business for pursuing profits."
Therefore, the policy of placing an emphasis on attaining academic achievements rather than pursuing profits from business was employed as "Ideal business rather than business for pursuing profits."

sen.j: こうしたことから、並行して材木の伐採も続けられていたが、しいたけ栽培の原木と用材の択伐のほか、枕木用の栗材や木炭生産用の雑木の伐採が主であった。
sen.e: In these situations, in the wood-cutting operation that was conducted at the same time, chestnut trees and miscellaneous small trees were mainly cut for making railroad ties and for making charcoal, respectively, in addition to the trees to make logs for cultivating shiitake mushrooms and the trees to generate woods for constructing buildings.

In these situations, chestnut trees and miscellaneous small trees were mainly cut in the logging operation that was conducted at the same time for making railroad ties and for making charcoal, respectively, in addition to the trees used to make logs for cultivating shiitake mushrooms and the producing wood for building construction.

Because of these situations, the logging of chestnut trees as the material for railroad ties and miscellaneous trees for charcoal making were the main activities, as well as the selective cutting for construction materials and pulpwood for the cultivation of shiitake mushrooms, although the logging lumber was still under way at the same time.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、昭和恐慌から日中戦争を経て太平洋戦争へと続く時代の流れの中で、軍事費増大による大学予算の削減から大学の収入源確保を求められたことや、国策遂行のために協力を求められた。
sen.e: However, in the era from the Showa Depression to the Sino-Japanese war and to the Pacific War, securing income sources for operating the university was requested because budget for the university was reduced due to an increase in military spending, and cooperation of the university was also requested for pursuing national policies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the era from the Showa Depression to the Sino-Japanese war and to the Pacific War, securing income sources for operating the university was requested because budget for the university was reduced due to an increase in military spending, and cooperation by the university was also requested to pursue national policies.

However, in the era from the Showa Depression to the Sino-Japanese War and to the Pacific War, securing income sources for operating the university was requested because budget for the university was reduced due to an increase in military spending, and cooperation by the university was also requested to pursue national policies.

sen.j: したがって、理想的な経営方針は変更を余儀なくされていく。
sen.e: Therefore, the university became to be forced to change the policy of the ideal business operation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the university came to be forced to change the policy of the ideal business operation.
Therefore, the university's ideal management policy began to be forced to change.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: 1934年に開通した森林軌道の沿線を中心に、木炭用の雑木や枕木用の栗材が大量に伐採された
sen.e: Lots of miscellaneous small tress and lots of chestnut trees along the forest tramroad, which started its operation in 1934, were cut for making charcoal and for making railroad ties, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Lots of miscellaneous small tress and chestnut trees along the forest tramroad, which started its operation in 1934, were cut to make charcoal and make railroad ties, respectively.
Lots of miscellaneous small tress and chestnut trees along the forest tramlines, which started its operation in 1934, were cut to make charcoal and make railroad ties.

sen.j: ほか、ブナ材は飛行機のプロペラ用や梱包材として伐採された。
sen.e: In addition, beech trees were cut as materials to make propellers of airplanes and as materials to make containers
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, beech trees were cut as materials to make propellers for airplanes and materials to make containers.
In addition, beech trees were cut as materials to make propellers for airplanes and materials to make containers.

sen.j: 中でも木炭の生産は年を追うことに増加し、昭和十年代における京都帝大の年間木炭需要1万4千俵を大きく上回る俵数を生産した。
sen.e: In particular, the amount of charcoal made there had increased year by year, largely exceeding 14,000 hyo (straw bags) that Kyoto Imperial University needed yearly in the era between mid-1930s and mid-1940s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In particular, the amount of charcoal made there had increased year by year, largely exceeding 14,000 hyo (straw bags) that Kyoto Imperial University needed yearly in the era between mid-1930s and mid-1940s.

In particular, the amount of charcoal made there had increased year by year, largely exceeding 14,000 hyo (straw bags) that Kyoto Imperial University needed yearly in the era between mid-1930s and mid-1940s.

sen.j: 余剰分は市中に販売されて貴重な収入源となったほか、「大学炭」として新聞にも紹介されるほどであった。
sen.e: The surplus charcoal was sold in the market, producing precious income, and descriptions of the charcoal appeared even on papers as "University charcoal."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The surplus charcoal was sold in the market, producing precious income, and descriptions of the charcoal appeared even on papers as "University charcoal."
The surplus charcoal was sold in the market, producing precious income, and descriptions of the charcoal appeared even in news papers as "University charcoal."

sen.j: 太平洋戦争に突入後は、総力戦遂行のための林業資源確保のために、1943年には小野子谷方面へ森林軌道の延伸が行われ、伐採面積の拡大に対応していった。
sen.e: After the Pacific War started, in order to secure resources for the forest industry to pursue all-out war, the forest tramroad was extended to the Onokodani area to deal with the expansion of the forest area where trees were cut.

After the Pacific War started, in order to secure resources for the forest industry to pursue all-out war, the forest tramroad was extended to the Onokodani area to deal with the expansion of the forest area where trees were cut.

After the Pacific War started, in order to secure the forest resource to pursue all-out war, the forest tramline was extended to the Onokodani area in 1943 to deal with the expansion of the forest area where trees were cut.
sen.cmt: resources for the forest industry→the forest resourcetramroad→tramlinein 1943 を挿入しました。

sen.j: こうした伐採面積の拡大は同時に演習林の荒廃を進行させることとなった。
sen.e: Such an expansion of the forest area where tress were cut devastated the forest increasingly more seriously at the same time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Such an expansion of the forest area where tress were cut devastated the forest in an increasingly serious manner at the same time.
Such an expansion of the forest area where tress were cut devastated the forest in an increasingly serious manner at the same time.

sen.j: しかい、戦時体制の前では如何ともしがたく、このまま終戦を迎えることとなった。
sen.e: However, nothing to stop it could be done under the war-time system, before the war ended.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, nothing to stop it could be done under the war-time system, before the war ended.

tit.e: The forest for field practice after the war (the third period)

sen.j: 大学本体は終戦後の1947年に京都帝国大学から京都大学に改称され、1949年には学制改革を実施して新制大学に改組された。
sen.e: Concerning the main body of the university itself, the name of the university was changed, in 1947 after the war, from Kyoto Imperial University to Kyoto University, and it was reformed into a university under the new system (of education) in 1949 through the educational system reform.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

Concerning the main body of the university itself, the name of the university was changed, in 1947 after the war, from Kyoto Imperial University to Kyoto University, and it was reformed into a university under the new system (of education) in 1949 through the reform of the educational system.

sen.j: しかい、演習林の体制に大きな変化はなかった。
sen.e: However, little change occurred about the system for the forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 一方で戦時中から続く演習林の荒廃は戦後も改善されることはなかった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the devastating situation of the forest for field practice during the war remained not improved even after the war.

On the other hand, the devastating situation of the field practice forest during the war remained unimproved even after the war.

sen.j: それに追い討ちをかけるように3度の台風被害に見舞われることとなった。
sen.e: In addition, the forest was further damaged by three typhoons, as one misfortune followed another.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the forest was further damaged by three typhoons, as one misfortune followed another.
In addition, the forest was further damaged by three typhoons, as one misfortune followed another.

sen.j: 1949年7月のへスター台風では演習林事務所で総雨量が519mm、東部の三国岳では推定600mmを超える記録的な大雨に見舞われ、演習林事務所を除く建物の大半が破損したり流失した。
sen.e: In Typhoon Hester that hit the area in July of 1949, record amounts of total rain fell in the area, 519 mm at the site of the administration office in the forest for field practice and more than 600 mm at Mikuni-dake Mountain, damaging or flowing away more than half of the buildings there, except the administration office.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Typhoon Hester that hit the area in July of 1949, record amounts of total rain fell in the area, 519 mm at the site of the administration office in the field practice forest and more than 600 mm at Mikuni-dake Mountain, damaging or destroying more than half of the buildings there, except the administration office.

In Typhoon Hester that hit the area in July 1949, record amounts of total rain fell in the area, 519 mm at the site of the administration office in the field practice forest and more than 600 mm at Mikuni-dake Mountain in the east, damaging or destroying more than half of the buildings there, except the administration office.
sen.cmt: of を削除しました。in the east を挿入しました。

sen.j: 更に、戦時中に開通した小野子東谷への森林軌道は全線流出・埋没するという大きな被害を受けた。
sen.e: In addition, all sections of the forest tramroad to Onoko Higashidani, which started its operation during the war, were flown away or buried.

sen.e: In addition, all sections of the forest tramroad to Onoko Higashidani, which started its operation during the war, were destroyed or buried.
In addition, all sections of the forest tramline to Onoko Higashidani, which started its operation during the war, were washed out or buried.

sen.j: 翌1950年9月にはジェーン台風が来襲、室戸台風並みの暴風をもたらしたことから、風倒木被害が多発した。
sen.e: In September of 1950, the next year, Typhoon Jane hit the area, bringing stormy wind comparable to that of Typhoon Muroto, with many trees fallen due to the wind.
In September of 1950, the next year, Typhoon Jane hit the area, bringing stormy wind comparable to that of Typhoon Muroto, with many trees fallen due to the wind.
In September 1950, the next year, Typhoon Jane hit the area, bringing stormy wind comparable to that of Typhoon Muroto, with many trees fallen due to the wind.

sen.j: それから間もない1953年9月には昭和28年台風第13号が来襲した。
sen.e: In September of 1953, shortly after that, Typhoon 13th in 1953 hit the area.
