sen.e: In September of 1953, shortly after that, Typhoon 13th in 1953 hit the area.
In September 1953, shortly after that, Typhoon 13 in 1953 hit the area.

sen.j: この台風では演習林事務所で総雨量361mmとへスター台風の時には及ばなかったものの、へスター、ジェーンの両台風で弱っていた山林に止めをさす結果となり、土砂災害などの被害を受けることとなった。
sen.e: Although the total amount of rainfall was 361 mm, not much as that at Typhoon Fester, it completely devastated the mountain forest that had deteriorated due to Typhoons Hesta and Jane, with both earth and sand damaged as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the total amount of rainfall was 361 mm, not as much as Typhoon Fester, it completely devastated the mountain forest that had deteriorated due to Typhoons Hesta and Jane, with both earth and sand damage as well.

Although the total amount of rainfall was 361mm, not as much as Typhoon Hester, it caused damage such as landslide disasters because the mountain forest had already been devastated by the both Typhoons Hester and Jane.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正Fester→HesterHesta→Hester土砂災害：landslide disasters とし、修正しました。

sen.j: 演習林にとっては大きな試練となった災害であるが、その復旧工事とともに、施設や林道の建設も推進されていった。
sen.e: These disasters provided a big ordeal to the forest for field practice, but the construction of facilities and forest roads was promoted together with the work to restore the forest state.
These disasters proved to be a big ordeal for the field practice forest, but the construction of facilities and forest roads was promoted together with the work to restore the state of the forest.
These disasters proved to be a big ordeal for the field practice forest, but the construction of facilities and forest roads was promoted together with the work to restore the state of the forest.

sen.j: 1950年には森林軌道が野田谷まで延伸されたほか、水力発電所を建設して電力の供給を開始した。
sen.e: In 1950, the forest tramroad was extended to Nodatani, and a hydraulic power station was built and the supply of its power started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1950, the forest tramroad was extended to Nodatani, and a hydraulic power station was built to start to supply power.
In 1950, along with the forest tramline extension to Nodatani, a hydraulic power station was built to start to supply power.
sen.cmt: tramroad→tramline 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: 1952年には地元住民への給電を開始した。
sen.e: In 1952, the supply of the electric power to local residents started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1952, the supply of the electric power to local residents started.
In 1952, the supply of the electric power to local residents started.

sen.j: 1961年には関西電力による電気の供給が開始された。
sen.e: In 1961, power supply by Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1961, power supply by Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. started.
In 1961, power supply by Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. started.

sen.j: しかｓ、このとき電気の来なかった灰野は住民が全員離村、最後まで残った山番の村も姿を消してしまった。
sen.e: However, all residents in Haino where the electric power was not supplied at this time left the village and the village of mountain guardians that had last remained also disappeared.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, all residents in Haino where electric power was not supplied at this time left the village and the village of mountain guardians that had remained also disappeared.
However, all residents in Haino where electric power was not supplied at this time left the village and the village of mountain guardians that had remained also disappeared.

sen.j: 林道の整備は内杉谷から下谷を経て長治谷に抜ける内杉林道を中心に進められた。
sen.e: Forest roads were laid out centered on the Uchisugidani forest road that ran from Uchisugidani to Chojidani via Shimotani.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Forest roads were laid out centered on the Uchisugidani forest road that ran from Uchisugidani to Chojidani via Shimotani.
Forest roads were laid out centered on the Uchisugidani forest road that ran from Uchisugidani to Chojidani via Shimotani.

sen.j: 1952年に落合橋まで開設されたのを皮切りに、1954年に幽仙橋まで延伸された。
sen.e: Initially, the portion up to Ochiai-bashi Bridge was laid out and then the road was extended up to Yusen-bashi Bridge.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Initially, the portion up to Ochiai-bashi Bridge was laid out and then the road was extended up to Yusen-bashi Bridge.
Initially, the portion up to Ochiai-bashi Bridge was laid out and then the road was extended up to Yusen-bashi Bridge.

sen.j: その後もケヤキ坂を越えて工事は進められて1970年に長治谷作業所に到達した。
sen.e: Even after that, the work continued over Keyaki-toge Pass and the road reached the Chojidani work site in 1970.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even after that, the work continued over Keyaki-toge Pass and the road reached the Chojidani work site in 1970.
Even after that, the work continued over Keyaki-toge Pass and the road reached the Chojidani work site in 1970.
sen.cmt: OK注）”ケヤキ坂＝ケヤキ峠”ということでしょうか。

sen.j: この他にも落合橋で内杉林道から分岐して櫃倉谷を詰める櫃倉林道が1955年に開設され、1972年には長治谷作業所から地蔵峠を越えて朽木村生杉に抜ける峰越林道が開設された。
sen.e: In addition, the Hitsukura forest road, which branched the Uchisugi forest road at Ochiai-bashi Bridge and reached a point close to Hitsukura-dani Valley, opened in 1955, and 1n 1972, the Minekoshi forest road, which ran from the Chojidani work site to Oisugi, Kutsuki Village, via Jizo-toge Pass opened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the Hitsukura forest road, which branched off the Uchisugi forest road at Ochiai-bashi Bridge and reached a point close to Hitsukura-dani Valley, opened in 1955, and 1n 1972, the Minekoshi forest road, which ran from the Chojidani work site to Oisugi, Kutsuki Village, via Jizo-toge Pass opened.

In addition, the Hitsukura forest road, which branched off the Uchisugi forest road at Ochiai-bashi Bridge and reached a point close to Hitsukura-dani Valley, opened in 1955, and in 1972, the Minekoshi forest road, which ran from the Chojidani work site to Oisugi, Kutsuki Village, via Jizo-toge Pass opened.

sen.j: さらに、1980年代にかけて内杉林道中央部のケヤキ峠を中心に、北は杉尾峠直下に通じ、南はブナノ木峠の南に達する林道が開設された。
sen.e: Furthermore, towards 1980s, a forest road opened that, with Keyaki-toge Pass in the middle of the Uchisugi forest road at its center, ran to the immediate foot of Sugio-toge Pass in the north and to the south side of Bunanoki-toge Pass in the south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, towards 1980s, a forest road opened that, with Keyaki-toge Pass in the middle of the Uchisugi forest road at its center, ran to the immediate foot of Sugio-toge Pass in the north and to the south side of Bunanoki-toge Pass in the south.

Furthermore, towards 1980s, a forest road opened that, with Keyaki-toge Pass in the middle of the Uchisugi forest road at its center, ran to the immediate foot of Sugio-toge Pass in the north and to the south side of Bunanoki-toge Pass in the south.

sen.j: 林道の整備は伐採面積の拡大を招くこととなった。
sen.e: The expansion of these forest roads resulted in increasing the forest area where trees were cut.
The expansion of these forest roads resulted in increasing the forest area where trees were logged.
The expansion of these forest roads resulted in increasing the forest area where trees were logged.

sen.j: 本格的な林道の整備が始まった1952年以降から伐採面積が急激に拡大した。
sen.e: In and after 1952 when the expansion of the forest roads started, the forest area where trees were cut increased rapidly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In and after 1952 when the expansion of the forest roads started, the forest area where trees were cut increased rapidly.
In and after 1952 when the real development of the forest roads started, the forest area where trees were cut increased rapidly.

sen.j: 1955年からは大面積の立木の直接売買も開始された。
sen.e: Starting in 1955, it also started to sell the still standing trees within large areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Starting in 1955, it also started to sell trees that were still standing within large areas.
It also started the direct sale of standing timber within large areas in 1955.
sen.cmt: to sell trees→the direct sale of the trees と修正しました。 立木:standing timber としました。

sen.j: 大規模伐採は1950年代後半と1960年代中盤に2度のピークを迎えている
sen.e: The large-scale tree-cutting business reached their peaks in the latter half of 1950s and around the middle of 1960s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The large-scale logging business reached their peak in the latter half of 1950s and around the middle of 1960s.
The large-scale logging business reached their peak in the latter half of 1950s and around the middle of 1960s.

sen.j: が、1950年代のピークは木材好況期にあたり、材木相場が高値で推移していたことが大きかった。
sen.e: The peak in the latter half of 1950s, corresponding to the boom period of demand for wood materials, was generated mostly because the market prices of woods remained high over the period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The peak in the latter half of 1950s, corresponding to the boom period of demand for wood materials, was generated mostly because the market prices of wood remained high during the period.
The peak in the latter half of 1950s, corresponding to the boom period of demand for wood materials, was generated mostly because the market prices of wood remained high during the period.

sen.j: 1960年代中期のピークは、1962年に当初の借地契約による分収金の効力が発生し、その支払いに充当するために大規模伐採を進めていたことが大きい。
sen.e: The peak around the middle of 1960s was generated mostly because, based on the initial land-leasing contract, it became necessary in 1962 to make a yearly payment (from profits from the tree-cutting business) and therefore, it became necessary to cut lots of trees to make the payment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The peak around the middle of 1960s was generated mostly because, based on the initial land-leasing contract, it became necessary in 1962 to make a yearly payment (from profits from the logging business) and therefore, it became necessary to log a numerous amount of trees to make the payment.

The peak around the middle of 1960s was generated mostly because, based on the initial land-leasing contract, it became necessary in 1962 to make a yearly payment (from profits from the logging business) and therefore, it became necessary to log a huge amount of trees to make the payment.

sen.j: その一方で、天然更新、人工造林の双方とも演習林の開設当初から進められてはいた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the activity to make the forest regenerated naturally and that to regenerate the forest artificially had been conducted since the start of the forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, a move to promote natural reforrestation and regenerate the forest artificially had been conducted since the start of the field practice forest.
On the other hand, both natural regeneration and artificial afforestation had been conducted since the start of the field practice forest.
sen.cmt: 天然更新、人口造林をそれぞれ:natural regeneration, artificial afforestation として修正しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、伐採面積の拡大に追いつくものではなかった。
sen.e: However, such regeneration of the forest could not catch up the increase in the expansion of the area where trees were cut.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, such reforestation could not catch up to the expansion in logging areas.
However, such reforestation could not catch up to the expansion in logging areas.

sen.j: また、植林された杉の価値も天然木に比べると低いものであった。
sen.e: In addition, the value of those planted Japanese cedar trees was rated lower that that of naturally-grown ones.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the value of those planted Japanese cedar trees was rated lower that that of naturally-grown ones.
In addition, the value of those planted Japanese cedar trees was rated lower than that of naturally-grown ones.

sen.j: したがって、トチやケヤキなどの天然林が次々と伐採されていった。
sen.e: Therefore, the natural forests of Aesculus turbinata and zelkova tree were destroyed one after another, with these trees being cut.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the natural forests of Aesculus turbinata and zelkova tree were destroyed one after another, with these trees being cut.
Therefore, the natural forests of horse chestnut and zelkova trees were cut one after another.
sen.cmt: トチ: horse chestnut としました。destroyed→cut,with these trees being cut を削除しました。

sen.j: その後も造林面積の拡大は遅々として進まず、植林された材木の価値の向上もはかばかしくなかった。
sen.e: Even after that, the area where trees were planted did increase little, and the quality of the trees that were planted did not improve satisfactorily.
Even after that, the area where trees were planted did increase little, and the quality of the trees that were planted did not improve satisfactorily.
Even after that, the area where trees were planted did increase little, and the value of the trees that were planted did not improve satisfactorily.

sen.j: 加えて、外材輸入の拡大に伴う国内材の価格低迷が重なった。
sen.e: In addition, corresponding to an increase in imported wood, the prices of domestic wood became stagnant.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, corresponding to an increase in imported wood, the price of domestic wood became stagnant.
In addition, corresponding to an increase in imported wood, the price of domestic wood became stagnant.

sen.j: したがって、伐採面積をさらに拡大して利益の確保を図るという悪循環に陥ってしまい、演習林の更なる荒廃を招く結果となった。
sen.e: Therefore, the vicious cycle of expanding the tree-cutting area to increase the profit set in, making the state of the forest for field practice further deteriorate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, a vicious cycle of expanding the tree-cutting area to increase the profit set in, making the state of the field practice forest further deteriorate.
Therefore, a vicious cycle of expanding the tree-cutting area to increase the profit set in, making the state of the field practice forest further deteriorate.

sen.j: また、1961年以降は伐採や搬出なども含めた造林をはじめ、苗圃、製材、林道工事などの分野で演習林での直接経営を拡大して研究面では大きな成果を挙げることができた。
sen.e: In addition, in and after 1961, big achievements were attained in the aspect of research through the expansion of the direct business operation in the forest for field practice, in such fields as afforestation, including cutting trees and carrying them out, nursery fields, making wood materials and the work to lay out forest roads.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, in and after 1961, big achievements were attained in the aspect of research through the expansion of the direct business operation in the field practice forest, in such fields as afforestation, including the logging and transportation of trees, nursery fields, making wood and laying out forest roads.

Also, in and after 1961, big achievements were attained in the aspect of research through the expansion of the direct business operation in the field practice forest, in such fields as afforestation, including the logging and transportation of trees, nursery fields, making wood and laying out forest roads.

sen.j: しかしながら、大学側の一般経常費による補填が少なかったことから無理な経営を行わざるを得なくなった。
sen.e: However, because the expenditure there was not compensated enough with the general expense on the university side, the forest operation side was forced to conduct an unreasonable business operation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because the expenditure there was not compensated enough with the general expense on the university side, the forest operation side was forced to conduct an unreasonable business operation.
However, because the compensation was not enough with the general expense on the university side, the forest operation side was therefore forced to conduct unsustainable management.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: そこに前述の木材価格の低迷が重なったことから、演習林の経営を圧迫してしまった。
sen.e: Then, as described above, wood prices became stagnant, squeezing the business operation of the forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Wood prices then became stagnant, squeezing the business operation of the field practice forest.
Wood prices then became stagnant, squeezing the business operation of the field practice forest.

sen.j: したがって、直営方式においても全面伐採から造林を繰り返すという悪循環から逃れられなくなってしまった。
sen.e: Therefore, even in the direct management system, the business operation could not get rid of repeating the vicious cycle that all trees in an area were cut and then trees were planted there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, even in the direct management system, the business operation could rid itself of the vicious cycle of logging trees in the area and then replanting them.
Therefore, even in the direct management system, the business operation could rid itself of the vicious cycle of logging all trees in the area and then replanting them.
sen.cmt: ”全面伐採”ということから、all を挿入しました。

sen.j: この間の1966年には折からのエネルギー革命と大学紛争の影響もあって、長らく続けられてきた製炭事業が廃止されている。
sen.e: In 1966, being affected by the energy revolution and university disputes at that time, the long-lasted charcoal-making business was discontinued.
In 1966, being affected by the energy revolution and university disputes at that time, the long-lasted charcoal-making business was discontinued.
In 1966, being affected by the energy revolution and the campus strife at that time, the long-lasting charcoal-making business was discontinued.

sen.j: こうした大規模伐採による演習林の荒廃が進むにつれて、大学関係者だけでなく地権者の側においても危惧と不安の声が上がるようになった。
sen.e: As the state of the forest for field practice deteriorated increasingly more gravely, not only persons on the university side but also the land-owning side began to voice anxiety and apprehension about the situation.

As the state of the field practice forest deteriorated even further, not only persons on the university side but also the land-owning side began to voice their anxiety and apprehension about the situation.

As the state of the field practice forest deteriorated even further by large scale logging, not only people on the university side but also the land-owning side began to voice their anxiety and apprehension about the situation.
sen.cmt: ”大規模伐採による”:by large scale logging を挿入しました。persons→people

sen.j: また、木材価格の低迷が長期化するにつれて、大規模伐採をこのまま続けても分収金の形で地域還元することが困難になってきていた。
sen.e: Furthermore, as the wood prices remain stagnant for a long period of time, it became difficult to make the yearly payment from the profit to the local communities, even though the business to cut trees on a large scale was continued as it was.

Furthermore, as wood prices remained stagnant for a long period of time, it became difficult to make the yearly payment from the profit to the local communities, even though the logging business continued to be carried out on a large scale.

Furthermore, as wood prices remained stagnant for a long period of time, it became difficult to make the yearly payment from the profit to the local communities, even though the logging business continued to be carried out on a large scale.

sen.j: こうしたことから地権者への使用料支払い方法も、従来の分収金方式から借地料支払いに転換することが検討された。
sen.e: In such a situation, it was investigated to change the method of making the payment for the land use to the land-owning side, from the previous one of making the payment from the profit to the new one of paying land lease rent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Under this situation, a method of making a payment for land use to the land-owning side, which differed from the previous method in that it that involved paying rent on a land lease as opposed to making payment from profits.

Under this situation, a method of making a payment for land use to the land-owning side was considered, which differed from the previous method in that it involved paying rent on a land lease as opposed to making payment from profits.
sen.cmt: was consideredを挿入しました。thatを削除しました。

sen.j: その場合の財源としては、大学一般財源で予算化することが望まれるようになった。
sen.e: In that case, it became to be desired to pay the rent from the general budget of the university.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this case, the university desired to pay the rent from their general budget.
In this case, the general revenue resources of the university was desired to pay the rent.
sen.cmt: 大学一般財源:general revenue resources of university としました。

sen.j: 1974年以降から国会 (日本)の場においても議論が重ねられ、1981年からは借地料方式が導入されることとなった。
sen.e: In and after 1974, this problem was also discussed repeatedly in the national diet of Japan as well, and it was decided in 1981 that the method of paying a land lease rent should be introduced.
In and after 1974, this problem was also discussed repeatedly in the national diet of Japan as well, and it was decided in 1981 that the method of paying rent on a land lease should be introduced.
From 1974, this problem was also discussed repeatedly in the Japanese diet as well, and the method of paying rent on a land lease was decided to be introduced from 1981.
sen.cmt: In and after→Fromnational diet→dietshould be→was decided to be

sen.j: このような動きに前後して、1970年以降は直営方式による演習林経営の規模が縮小されたほか、1975年以降は伐採面積が大幅に減少していった。
sen.e: While and after these activities were underway, the scale of direct business operation of the forest for field practice was reduced in and after 1970, and the area where trees were cut decreased significantly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While these activities were underway, the scale of direct business operation of the field practice forest was reduced in and after 1970, and the area where trees were cut decreased significantly.

While these activities were underway, the scale of direct business operation of the field practice forest was reduced in and after 1970, and the area where trees were cut decreased significantly after1975.

sen.j: したがって、1970年代後半から1980年代初めにかけて、演習林の利用形態も再び研究を主体としたものに変わっていった。
sen.e: Therefore, in the eras from the latter half of 1970s to the early 1980s, the forest for field practice became to be used mainly for research purposes again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, from the latter half of the 1970s to the early 1980s, the field practice forest came to be used mainly for research purposes again.
Therefore, from the latter half of the 1970s to the early 1980s, the field practice forest came to be used mainly for research purposes again.

sen.j: 高度経済成長期の産業構造の変化と、外材輸入に伴う木材価格の低迷は林業の衰退と過疎化を招いた。
sen.e: Changes in the industrial structure in the high economic growth period and the stagnant wood prices due to imported wood caused the forest industry to decline and the population in forest areas to decrease.

Changes in the industrial structure in the high economic growth period and the stagnant wood prices due to imported wood caused the forest industry to decline and the population in forest areas to decrease.

Changes in the industrial structure in the high economic growth period and the stagnant wood prices due to imported wood caused the forest industry to decline and the population in forest areas to decrease.

sen.j: 演習林がある美山町（旧知井村）もまた例外ではなかった。
sen.e: Miyama Town (former Chii Village) was no exception.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Miyama Town (former Chii Village) was no exception.
Miyama-cho (former Chii Village) was no exception.

sen.j: 林業や製炭といった主力産業が年とともに衰退していった。
sen.e: The main businesses there, such as the forest industry and the business of making charcoal, continued declining year by year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The main businesses there, such as the forest industry and the business of making charcoal, continued to decline year by year.
The main businesses there, such as the forest industry and the business of making charcoal, continued to decline year by year.

sen.j: さらに、京阪神大都市圏に近接していたことから青壮年層を中心に人口の流出が続き、過疎化が進展していった。
sen.e: In addition, since the area was placed near to the Keihanshin metropolitan region, persons in the area, centered on young persons or those in their prime of life, continued to flow out of the area, decreasing the population there correspondingly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, persons in the area, centered on young persons or those in their prime of life, continued to flow out of the area, decreasing the population, since the area was located close to the Keihanshin metropolitan region,

In addition, persons in the area, centered on young persons or those in their prime of life, continued to flow out of the area, decreasing the population, since the area was located close to the Keihanshin metropolitan region,

sen.j: 一方、京阪神都市圏では経済成長と人口増に伴って電力需要が増加、関西電力では木曽川流域や黒部川第四発電所及び黒部ダムといった黒部川流域での電源開発をおこなった。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the Keihanshin metropolitan region, demand for electric power increased rapidly corresponding to economic growth and an increase in the population, and Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. developed electric power resources in the Kiso-gawa River valley and in the Kurobe-gawa River valley, such as Kurobegawa No.4 Hydro Power Plant and the Kurobe dam.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, in the Keihanshin metropolitan region, demand for electric power increased rapidly corresponding to economic growth and an increase in the population, and Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. developed electric power resources in the Kiso-gawa River valley and in the Kurobe-gawa River valley, such as Kurobegawa No.4 Hydro Power Plant and the Kurobe dam.

On the other hand, in the Keihanshin metropolitan region, demand for electric power increased rapidly corresponding to economic growth and an increase in the population, and Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. developed electric power resources in the Kiso-gawa River valley and in the Kurobe-gawa River valley, such as Kurobegawa No.4 Hydro Power Plant and the Kurobe Dam.

sen.j: 名称も広く親しまれていた「芦生演習林」から「芦生研究林」に変更されて現在に至っている。
sen.e: The name of the forest was changed from the forest for field practice to the forest for research at that time, with the name being retained up to today.
The name of the forest was changed from the forest for field practice to the forest for research at that time, with the name being retained up to today.
The name of the forest was changed from the "forest for field practice", which was widely used, to the "forest for research", which is used up to today.

tit.e: The problems in the past and today
Problems in the past and today
Problems in the past and today

sen.j: 当研究林は、かつては自ら収益を上げることである程度の独立採算を図ることと大学の財政運営に寄与することが求められた。
sen.e: In the past, it was requested for the operation of this forest for research to finance itself to some extent through earning income by itself and to contribute to the finance of the university.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the past, it was requested that operation of the research forest finance itself to some extent by earning income by itself and contribute to the finance of the university.
In the past, it was requested that operation of the research forest finance itself to some extent by earning income by itself and contribute to the finance of the university.

sen.j: このことが借地の上に運営されていることと重なって、結果として大規模伐採～森林の荒廃という悪循環を招くこととなった。
sen.e: This situation, in addition to the fact that the forest for field practice was operated on leased land, resultantly caused that the vicious cycle of cutting trees on a large scale and making the forest deteriorate was generated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This situation, in addition to the fact that the field practice forest was operated on leased land, caused the vicious cycle in large scale logging as well as deterioration of the forest.
This situation, in addition to the fact that the field practice forest was operated on leased land, caused the vicious cycle in large scale logging as well as deterioration of the forest.

sen.j: また、昨今では利用者に対して門戸が広く開放されていることが研究林のオーバーユースを招き、結果として林内の環境悪化につながるという問題を抱えている。
sen.e: In addition, being open to use by general public has recently caused overuse of the forest for research, generating the problem that the environments within the forest have been degraded resultantly.
In addition, being open to use by general public has recently caused overuse of the research forest, generating environmental problems within the forest, causing it to deteriorate as a result.
In addition, being open to use by general public has recently caused overuse of the research forest, generating environmental problems within the forest, causing it to deteriorate as a result.

sen.j: この項では研究林の課題について紹介する。
sen.e: The following describe the problems of the forest for research
The following describe the issues related to the research forest.
The following describe the issues related to the research forest.

sen.j: 前述のように、国内の木材価格が高く、薪炭が熱エネルギーの中心だった時期においては、大学演習林において伐採した材木のほか木炭などの林産資源を売ることで収益を上げることは当然とされている。
sen.e: As described above, in the era when wood prices in Japan were high and firewood and charcoal were the main sources of thermal energy, it was naturally considered that income could be gained through selling the resources of the forest industry, such as charcoal, in addition to the wood cut in the forest for field practice of a university.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As described above, in an era when wood prices in Japan were high and firewood and charcoal were the main sources of thermal energy, it was naturally considered that income could be gained by selling forest industry resources, such as charcoal, in addition to wood cut in the field practice forest of a university.

As described above, in an era when wood prices in Japan were high and firewood and charcoal were the main sources of thermal energy, it was naturally considered that income could be gained by selling forest resources, such as charcoal, in addition to wood cut in the field practice forest of a university.

sen.j: 芦生演習林においても伐採と施業によって収益を上げることで、「大学財政に寄与する演習林の経営」という考え方があったのはある意味自然である。
sen.e: Therefore, it was natural in a certain sense that, in the operation of the Ashiu forest for field practice, there was also the concept of "the operation of the forest for field practice contributing to the university finance through cutting trees in the Ashiu forest for filed practice and doing business based on them."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it was natural in a certain sense that, in the operation of the Ashiu forest for field practice, there was also the concept of "the operation of the forest for field practice contributing to the university finance through cutting trees in the Ashiu forest for filed practice and doing business based on them."

Therefore, it was natural in a certain sense that, in the operation of the Ashiu forest for field practice, there was the idea of "the management of the forest for field practice for contributing to the university finance" by cutting trees and doing business in the forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて修正しました。伐採と施業の部分

sen.j: 特に当時の京都帝国大学では国内演習林の開設が他大学に遅れた。
sen.e: In particular, Kyoto Imperial University at that time was later than other universities in opening a forest for field practice in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In particular, Kyoto Imperial University at that time was later than other universities in opening a forest for field practice in Japan.
In particular, Kyoto Imperial University at that time was behind other universities in opening domestic forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: later than→behindin Japan を domestic に修正しまし。

sen.j: さらに、演習林開設に要した予算が当時の大学予算の約1/5に達しただけでなく、1923年の契約更改で地権者に支払われた22万円は、こちらも大学予算の約1/10に達する額であった。
sen.e: In addition, the budget needed for establishing the forest for field practice reached approx. 1/5 of the budget of the university, and furthermore the 220,000 yen paid to the land-owning side when the contract was renewed in 1923 reached approx. 1/10 of the budget of the university as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the budget needed to establish the field practice forest reached approx. 1/5 of the budget of the university, and furthermore the 220,000 yen paid to the land-owning side when the contract was renewed in 1923 reached approx. 1/10 of the budget of the university as well.

In addition, the budget needed to establish the field practice forest reached approx. 1/5 of the budget of the university, and furthermore the 220,000 yen paid to the land-owning side when the contract was renewed in 1923 reached approx. 1/10 of the budget of the university as well.

sen.j: このような状況では、先発の大学国内演習林のように、地権者から土地を購入して演習林を開設することは無理な話であった。
sen.e: In these situations, it was almost impossible to purchase the land from the land-owning side in order to establish the forest for field practice, as other universities did to establish their forests for field practice in Japan.

In these situations, it was almost impossible to purchase the land from the land-owning side in order to establish the field practice forest, as other universities did to establish their forests for field practice in Japan.

In these situations, it was almost impossible to purchase the land from the land-owning side in order to establish the field practice forest, as other universities already did to establish their domestic forests for field practice.
sen.cmt: “先発の”というところを already と挿入しました。

sen.j: ところが、投資経費を回収するために伐採と施業を行っても、その収益は地形上・植生上から市場価値の高い材木が少なく、搬出も道路が未整備であることから、コストの高い筏流しに頼らざるを得ず、予想より低いものであった。
sen.e: However, although the business of cutting tress and selling them was conducted, trying to recover the invested amount of cost, the profit was less than expected due to the following reasons: The wood highly evaluated in the market was scanty there from the reasons of the geological shape of the land and the characteristics of the vegetation and, in addition, to carry out the cut wood, the costly method of forming them into rafts and to flow the rafts down a river had to be used, because no appropriate road was available.

However, although the logging and sale of trees was conducted, the profit was less than expected due to the following reasons: the wood highly evaluated in the market was scanty there from the reasons of the geological shape of the land and the characteristics of the vegetation and, in addition, to carry out the cut wood, the costly method of forming them into rafts and to flow the rafts down a river had to be used, because no appropriate road was available.
sen.cmt: Robert: Translation doesn’t make sense "the wood highly evaluated in the market was scanty there from the reasons of the geological shape of the land"
sen.e: However, although logging and forest management were conducted to recover the cost of the investment, the earnings were lower than expected because the area's geographical features and vegetation meant that there was a lack of wood with a high market value, and inadequate access roads meant that there was a dependence on high-cost rafting to transport the wood.
sen.cmt: 原文から考えて修正しました。

sen.j: もっとも、立地条件等を勘案して、大学当局も不利を承知で演習林を開設したものであるが、「帝国大学の演習林」という看板が地元に過度の期待を抱かせることとなった。
sen.e: Although the university took account of the conditions of the site and other factors and established the forest for field practice while knowing its disadvantageous position, the local community side expected too much from the name of "a forest for field practice of an imperial university"

sen.j: 結果として演習林開設当初の契約不履行問題となってはね返ってしまった。
sen.e: Resultantly, this situation produced the problem of "breach of contract" shortly after the forest of field practice was established.

sen.e: As a result this situation produced a "breach of contract" shortly after the forest of field practice was established.

sen.j: それでも、戦中戦後の混乱期を経ながらも伐採と施業によって一定の収益を上げることができ、大学の財産形成に寄与したほか、一定ながらも地域還元が行われた。
sen.e: Even so, while experiencing the turbulent period during and after the war, the operation of the forest could attain a certain amount of profit through cutting trees and doing based on them, contributing to the formation of wealth of the university and returning some of the profit to the local communities, although it was a fixed amount.

Even so, the operation of the forest could attain a certain amount of profit by logging trees despite experiencing the turbulent period during and after the war, and contributed to the formation of wealth of the university and returned some of the profit to the local communities, although it was a fixed amount.

Even so, the operation of the forest could attain a certain amount of profit by logging trees despite experiencing the turbulent period during and after the war, and contributed to the formation of wealth of the university and returned some of the profit to the local communities, although it was a fixed amount.

sen.j: その後、分収金の効力が発生すると、今度はその支払いに追われることとなった。
sen.e: After that, when the time to make a yearly payment based on the profit arrived, the forest operation side became to be tormented to make the payment.
After that, when the time to make a yearly payment based on the profit arrived, the forest operation side was pestered to make their payment.
After that, when the time to make a yearly payment based on the profit arrived, the forest operation side was pestered to make their payment.

sen.j: 前述のように天然更新や人工造林された材木の価値が低いとなると、つまるところ天然林の伐採に収益の主力を置くこととなる。
sen.e: As described above, the quality of the wood from the naturally regenerated forests and from the artificially regenerated forests was poor, and therefore, to attain profits, it became that tress mainly in the natural forest had to be cut after all.

As described above, the quality of the wood from the naturally regenerated forests and from the artificially regenerated forests was poor, and therefore, it turned out that most of the trees from the natural forest had to be cut down afterall.

As described above, the value of the wood from the naturally regenerated forests and from the artificially regenerated forests is low, and therefore, it turns out that logging of the natural forest becomes the focus of earnings.

sen.j: そこに木材価格の低迷が重なった。
sen.e: In such a situation, wood prices became stagnant as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Under this situation, wood prices stagnated as well.
Under this situation, wood prices stagnated as well.

sen.j: したがって、地権者への分収金支払いのためにさらに天然林の大規模伐採を行うという悪循環に陥ってしまい、結果として収益を上げるどころか演習林の荒廃という事態を招くこととなった。
sen.e: Therefore, the forest operation fell into the vicious cycle of cutting even more tress in the natural forests to earn the profit to make the yearly payment based on the profit to the land-owning side, resulting in the situation that the state of the forest for field practice deteriorated, far from earning profits.

Therefore, the forest operation fell into a vicious cycle of logging even more tress in the natural forests to earn enough profit to make the yearly payment based on the profit to the land-owning side, resulting in a situation whereby the state of the field practice forest deteriorated, and was far from earning profits.

sen.j: また、借地であった。
sen.e: In addition, the land was leased.

sen.e: In addition, the land was leased.
In addition, the land was leased.

sen.j: ことから揚水ダム建設計画時に地元から演習林の返還要求が出されると、施設の存続が危ぶまれるような事態にまで発展することもあった。
sen.e: Therefore, when the local community side requested for returning the land for the plan to construct dams for pumped water, the problem developed to the serious state that the existence of the forest for field practice itself was threatened.

Therefore, when the local community side requested the return of the land that was to be used in constructing a dam to pump water, the problem became so serious that the very existence of the forest itself was threatened.

sen.j: 大学側も地元側も、演習林の発足時に、「高収益の演習林事業」という夢を描いてしまい、そこからなかなか脱却できなかった。
sen.e: When the forest for field practice was established, both of the university side and the local community side nurtured the dream of "high-profit business based on the forest for field practice and could not get rid of the dream for a long period of time.

When the field practice forest was established, both the university side and the local community side nurtured the dream of "high-profit business based on the field practice forest" and could not get rid of the dream for a long period of time.

sen.j: このことが演習林の経営に影をさす要因となったことは否めない。
sen.e: It could not be denied that this situation cast a shadow over the operation of the forest for field practice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It could not be denied that this situation cast a shadow over the operation of the forest for field practice.
It could not be denied that this situation cast a shadow over the management of the forest for field practice.

sen.j: 最近の当研究林では、入林者の増加によるオーバーユースが大きな課題となっている。

In this research forest, there has been a substantial problem in overuse due to the increase in the number of people entering the forest.

sen.j: 特に研究林東部の高島市（旧朽木村）側から地蔵峠を経て長治谷に向かうコースは、前述のとおりアプローチが短い。

sen.j: このコースを使えば、容易に上谷から杉尾峠方面への核心部を訪ねることができる。

sen.j: したがって、大学側においても大人数での入林をしないことや決められた歩道以外への入林禁止、ペット同伴での入林禁止といった啓発活動に務め、アンケートを通じて入林者に研究林の現状を知らせたほか、2006年からは高島市側からの入林を原則禁止するなどの措置をとった。
sen.e: Therefore, the university side has taken the following measures as well: making it well known that a large number of persons are prohibited from entering the forest at the same time, it is prohibited to enter any other place than roads in the forest, and persons with pets are prohibited from entering this forest, and making the visitors know the present state of the forest for research, through making them fill in questionnaires, and prohibiting entering this forest form the Takashima City side staring in 2006.

Therefore, the university has taken the following measures as well: making it well known that a large number of persons are prohibited from entering the forest at the same time; it is prohibited to enter any other place than paths in the forest; persons with pets are prohibited from entering this forest; making the visitors know the present state of the research forest by making them fill in questionnaires; and prohibiting entering this forest from the Takashima City side from 2006.

sen.e: Naturally, it is requested for the persons entering this forest to understand that this forest for research is a facility of a university, not an ordinary sightseeing spot, and that they must follow the rules in entering the forest.

Naturally, it is requested that persons entering this forest understand that this research forest is a university facility and not an ordinary sightseeing spot, and that they must follow the rules upon entering the forest.

sen.j: また、ニホンジカが、近年の暖冬傾向で冬場に抵抗力のない子供や老年の個体が死亡する数が減っていることや天敵がいない自然環境に加え、研究林が禁猟区域であることから個体数が増加傾向にある。
sen.e: The number of Japanese deer has been increasing for the following reasons: Warm winter climates in the recent years have decreased the number of deaths of young or old deer that are vulnerable to severe winter climates, there exists no animal to prey on them in the natural environment, and hunting is prohibited in the forest for research.

The number of Japanese deer has been increasing for the following reasons: Warm winter climates in recent years have decreased the number of deaths of young or old deer that are vulnerable to severe winter climates, there exists no animal to prey on them in their natural environment, and hunting is prohibited in the research forest.

The number of Japanese deer has been increasing for the following reasons: Warm winter climates in recent years have decreased the number of deaths of young or old deer that are vulnerable to severe winter climates, there exists no animal to prey on them in their natural environment, and hunting is prohibited in the research forest.

sen.j: この結果、下草を食い尽くされるだけでなく、若木の樹皮も食べるなど、食害が年々拡大している。
sen.e: Resultantly, the damage caused by the animals eating not only the undergrowth but also the barks of young tress has increased year by year.
As a result the damage caused by animals eating not only the undergrowth but also the barks of young tress has increased year by year.
As a result the damage caused by grazing habits of animals, which are eating not only the undergrowth but also the bark of young tress, has been expanding year by year.
sen.cmt: ”食害が・・・拡大している”という部分を付け加えました。

sen.j: 放置しておくと植生に悪影響を与える。
sen.e: If no measure is taken against this problem, the vegetation will be affected badly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If no measure is taken against this problem, the vegetation will be affected drastically.
If no measures are taken against this problem, the vegetation will be badly affected.
sen.cmt: measure is→measures are, affected drastically→badly affected

sen.j: しかしながら、有効な手立てがないだけに解決の難しい問題である。
sen.e: However, with no effective measure existing, it is a difficult problem for which a solution could not be found easily..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
